description:
## Overview
[github.com/gophish/gophish/middleware](https://github.com/gophish/gophish) is a Package middleware is responsible for the definition/​implementation of middleware functionality.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The Reset button on the Account Settings page allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a clickjacking attack.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gophish/gophish/middleware` to version 0.11.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/commit/6df62e85fd60f0931d3c8bfdb13b436a961bc9b6)
- [Security Advisory](https://herolab.usd.de/security-advisories/usd-2020-0051/)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/helm/helm/pkg/plugin](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/helm/helm/pkg/plugin) is a package manager for Kubernetes.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution. A Helm plugin can contain duplicates of the same entry, with the last one always used. If a plugin is compromised, this lowers the level of access that an attacker needs to modify a plugins install hooks, causing a local execution attack. To perform this attack, an attacker must have write access to the git repository or plugin archive (.tgz) while being downloaded (which can occur during a MITM attack on a non-SSL connection).
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/helm/helm/pkg/plugin` to version 2.16.11, 3.3.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/helm/helm/security/advisories/GHSA-c52f-pq47-2r9j)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/6aab63765f99050b115f0aec3d6350c85e8da946)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/helm/helm/commit/d9ef5ce8bad512e325390c0011be1244b8380e4b)
title: Arbitrary Code Execution

description:
## Overview
[github.com/openshift/builder/pkg/build/builder](https://github.com/openshift/builder) is a package for image run by build pods to execute image building+pushing.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficient Hostname Verification. Builds that extract source from a container image can bypass the TLS host-name verification server identity check to ensure that the client is talking to the correct server and has not been redirected by a man in the middle attacker.
## Remediation
A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published.
## References
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/openshift/builder/commit/5d8b75d5bd96cfd5b900498db774fb3d24212054#diff-986cfe99352ecdaac7e8c0d4e47bdbd4)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1754662)
title: Insufficient Hostname Verification

description:
## Overview
[github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/staging/src/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy) is a package that provides transport and upgrade support for proxies.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Privilege Escalation. Incorrect handling of error responses to proxied upgrade requests in the `kube-apiserver` allowed specially crafted requests to establish a connection through the Kubernetes API server to backend servers, then send arbitrary requests over the same connection directly to the backend, authenticated with the Kubernetes API servers TLS credentials used to establish the backend connection.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/staging/src/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy` to version 1.10.11, 1.11.5, 1.12.3 or higher.
## References
- [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/46053)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/2257c1ecbe3c0cf71dd50b82752ae189c94ec905)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/71411)
- [Google Forum Report](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/kubernetes-announce/GVllWCg6L88)
title: Privilege Escalation

description:
## Overview
[github.com/containers/image/docker](https://github.com/containers/image) is a package used within containers/image to work with containers images

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Man-in-the-Middle (MitM). None
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/containers/image/docker` to version 3.0.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/containers/image/pull/655)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/containers/image/pull/669)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1732508)
title: Man-in-the-Middle (MitM)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/docker/libcontainer](https://github.com/docker/libcontainer) is a package that provides a native Go implementation for creating containers with namespaces, cgroups, capabilities, and filesystem access controls.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Access Restriction Bypass. None
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/docker/libcontainer` to version 1.0.0-rc9 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/crosbymichael/runc/commit/78dce1cf1ec36bbe7fe6767bdb81f7cbf6d34d70)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/issues/2128)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/pull/2129)
title: Access Restriction Bypass

description:
## Overview

[github.com/uber/prototool/internal/protoc](https://godoc.org/github.com/uber/prototool/internal/protoc) is a package for Protocol Buffers.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction (Zip Slip).
Files within a zip file can break out of the target directory when being extracted.

## Details
It is exploited using a specially crafted zip archive, that holds path traversal filenames. When exploited, a filename in a malicious archive is concatenated to the target extraction directory, which results in the final path ending up outside of the target folder. For instance, a zip may hold a file with a ../../file.exe location and thus break out of the target folder. If an executable or a configuration file is overwritten with a file containing malicious code, the problem can turn into an arbitrary code execution issue quite easily.

The following is an example of a zip archive with one benign file and one malicious file. Extracting the malicous file will result in traversing out of the target folder, ending up in `/root/.ssh/` overwriting the `authorized_keys` file:

```

+2018-04-15 22:04:29 ..... 19 19 good.txt

+2018-04-15 22:04:42 ..... 20 20 ../../../../../../root/.ssh/authorized_keys

```

## Remediation

There is no fixed version for `github.com/uber/prototool/internal/protoc`.


## References

- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/uber/prototool/issues/497)

- [Vulnerable Code](https://github.com/uber/prototool/blob/dev/internal/protoc/downloader.go#L245)
title: Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction (Zip Slip)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/gophish/gophish/controllers](https://github.com/gophish/gophish) is a package middleware is responsible for the definition/​implementation of middleware functionality.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The Reset button on the Account Settings page allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a clickjacking attack.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gophish/gophish/controllers` to version 0.11.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/commit/6df62e85fd60f0931d3c8bfdb13b436a961bc9b6)
- [Security Advisory](https://herolab.usd.de/security-advisories/usd-2020-0051/)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet) is a package that contains the libraries that drive the Kubelet binary. The kubelet is responsible for node level pod management. It runs on each worker in the cluster.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The Kubernetes kubelet component does not account for disk usage by a pod which writes to its own `/etc/hosts` file. The `/etc/hosts` file mounted in a pod by kubelet is not included by the kubelet eviction manager when calculating ephemeral storage usage by a pod. If a pod writes a large amount of data to the `/etc/hosts` file, it could fill the storage space of the node and cause the node to fail.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet` to version 1.16.13, 1.17.9, 1.18.6 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/530f199b6e07cdaab32361e39709ac45f3fdc446)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/68750fefd3df76b7b008ef7b18e8acd18d5c2f2e)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/7fd849cffa2f93061fbcb0a6ae4efd0539b1e981)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/93032)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/92921)
- [Kubernetes Security Advisory](https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-security-announce/c/cB_JUsYEKyY/m/vVSO61AhBwAJ)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[`grootfs`](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/grootfs) is the Cloud Foundry component that provides filesystem isolation for containers and deals with container (Docker and OCI) images.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cache Poisoning.

Cloud Foundry Foundation GrootFS release 0.3.x versions prior to 0.30.0 do not validate DiffIDs, allowing specially crafted images to poison the grootfs volume cache. For example, this could allow an attacker to provide an image layer that GrootFS would consider to be the Ubuntu base layer.

## References
- [Cloudfoundry Security Advisory](https://www.cloudfoundry.org/cve-2017-14388/)
title: Cache Poisoning
